intro: Scleria flagellum-nigrorum, commonly known as black-stemmed scleria, is a perennial grass-like plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dark, wiry stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Scleria flagellum-nigrorum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to salt spray and sandy soils.
